Medicine_19_r.News Finding: The research follows an earlier study which suggested that elevated long-term levels of cortisol may reduce the likelihood of a successful outcome for patients trying to conceive by IVF.
Medicine_19_r.Paper Finding: Despite these potential limitations, the present study extends the available evidence for the role of cortisol on clinical pregnancy in IVF patients and provides the first evidence that elevated chronic cortisol levels are associated with a reduced likelihood of pregnancy.
Medicine_19_r.News Context: The research follows an earlier study which suggested that elevated long-term levels of cortisol may reduce the likelihood of a successful outcome for patients trying to conceive by IVF. However, many factors influence cortisol (including physical activity, sleep and some aspects of our diet such as caffeine) and so it is possible that any or all of these factors may account for the effects of cortisol on pregnancy." If this is proven with further solid research it may modify our approach to pre-IVF testing in all patients.
Medicine_19_r.Paper Context: It is also not clear how generalizable our results are to women trying to conceive naturally; also our findings extend only to clinical pregnancy. Despite these potential limitations, the present study extends the available evidence for the role of cortisol on clinical pregnancy in IVF patients and provides the first evidence that elevated chronic cortisol levels are associated with a reduced likelihood of pregnancy. Thus, further research is needed to not only corroborate these findings but also identify the pathways.
Medicine_19_r.text: ['Finding: The research follows an earlier study which suggested that elevated long-term levels of cortisol may reduce the likelihood of a successful outcome for patients trying to conceive by IVF.']
Medicine_19_r.displayed_text: Finding: The research follows an earlier study which suggested that elevated long-term levels of cortisol may reduce the likelihood of a successful outcome for patients trying to conceive by IVF.

Medicine_26_r.News Finding: Systolic BP readings with the IBP app were within 5 mm Hg of the standard measurement 24% of the time, within 10 mm Hg 44% of the time, and within 15 mm Hg 59% of the time; diastolic BP readings were within 55 mm Hg of the standard measurement 26% of the time, within 10 mm Hg 48% of the time, and 15 mm Hg 70% of the time.
Medicine_26_r.Paper Finding: IBP systolic BP readings were within , 10, and 1 mm Hg of the standard BP measurement 24%, 44%, and 9% of the time, respectively, whereas respective proportions for diastolic BP were 26%, 48%, and 70%, correlating with the lowest possible accuracy grade in all categories by British Hypertensive Society scoring.
Medicine_26_r.News Context: The researchers found that higher BP measures were underestimated and lower BP measures were overestimated. Systolic BP readings with the IBP app were within 5 mm Hg of the standard measurement 24% of the time, within 10 mm Hg 44% of the time, and within 15 mm Hg 59% of the time; diastolic BP readings were within 55 mm Hg of the standard measurement 26% of the time, within 10 mm Hg 48% of the time, and 15 mm Hg 70% of the time. These measurements correlated with the lowest possible accuracy grade in all categories by British Hypertensive Society scoring.
Medicine_26_r.Paper Context: IBP underestimated higher BPs and overestimated lower BPs (Figure) . IBP systolic BP readings were within , 10, and 1 mm Hg of the standard BP measurement 24%, 44%, and 9% of the time, respectively, whereas respective proportions for diastolic BP were 26%, 48%, and 70%, correlating with the lowest possible accuracy grade in all categories by British Hypertensive Society scoring. Spearman ρ was 0.44 (P < .001) for systolic BP and 0.41 (P < .001) for diastolic BP.

Medicine_403_r.News Finding: No child had both SCQ and ADOS scores in the relevant ranges that would lead to an ASD diagnosis.
Medicine_403_r.Paper Finding: In this study, not one child met strict diagnostic criteria for ASD using results of both the ADOS and SCQ.
Medicine_403_r.News Context: Only two -- 7 percent -- had SCQ scores above the cut off. No child had both SCQ and ADOS scores in the relevant ranges that would lead to an ASD diagnosis. It's quite clear that children with the disorder do have social impairments," Simon said.
Medicine_403_r.Paper Context: While it is important to note that research evaluations are not substitutes for clinical evaluations, it is useful to examine the yield of ASD diagnoses based on criteria that more closely resemble what is used in clinical practice (both directly administered assessment and parental history). In this study, not one child met strict diagnostic criteria for ASD using results of both the ADOS and SCQ. Given the similar prevalence rates (44-68 %) we found based on BASC-PRS, it seems that the difference in diagnostic methodology is the primary reason for the discrepancy between the percentage of children meeting criteria for an ASD diagnosis in our study and the prevalence of ASD in the 22q11.2DS literature for children in this age range Niklasson et al.
Medicine_403_r.text: ['Finding: No child had both SCQ and ADOS scores in the relevant ranges that would lead to an ASD diagnosis.']
Medicine_403_r.displayed_text: Finding: No child had both SCQ and ADOS scores in the relevant ranges that would lead to an ASD diagnosis.

Medicine_tweet_59_r.News Finding: In our latest @username funded study in @username, people with severe obesity & diabetes who had bariatric surgery were associated with 40% lower 5-year risk of heart attack and stroke than matched people who got usual medical care
Medicine_tweet_59_r.Paper Finding: Health care professionals should engage patients with severe obesity and type 2 diabetes in a shared decision making conversation about the potential role of bariatric surgery in the prevention of macrovascular events.
Medicine_tweet_59_r.News Context: In our latest @username funded study in @username, people with severe obesity & diabetes who had bariatric surgery were associated with 40% lower 5-year risk of heart attack and stroke than matched people who got usual medical care
Medicine_tweet_59_r.Paper Context: The findings require confirmation in randomized clinical trials. Health care professionals should engage patients with severe obesity and type 2 diabetes in a shared decision making conversation about the potential role of bariatric surgery in the prevention of macrovascular events. [5] [6] [7] [8] [9] In comparison, patients who have bariatric surgery have better glycemic control and greater macrovascular risk factor reduction than those who get both intensive lifestyle and medical treatment combined.
Medicine_tweet_59_r.text: ['Finding: In our latest @username funded study in @username, people with severe obesity & diabetes who had bariatric surgery were associated with 40% lower 5-year risk of heart attack and stroke than matched people who got usual medical care ']
Medicine_tweet_59_r.displayed_text: Finding: In our latest @username funded study in @username, people with severe obesity & diabetes who had bariatric surgery were associated with 40% lower 5-year risk of heart attack and stroke than matched people who got usual medical care

Medicine_7_r.News Finding: However, the study found that you can significantly lower your risk for cardiovascular disease by eating fresh fruit, including apples.
Medicine_7_r.Paper Finding: In men, the risk reduction was 19% in the group consuming >54 g compared to no apple intake .
Medicine_7_r.News Context: And a probiotic-rich diet supports diverse gut microbiome, which can potentially protect you from cardiac conditions and autoimmune diseases, among other benefits that scientists are still uncovering. However, the study found that you can significantly lower your risk for cardiovascular disease by eating fresh fruit, including apples. Apples Lower Cholesterol Shutterstock You probably don't spending much time thinking about cholesterol because it's something only older folks need to worry about, right?
Medicine_7_r.Paper Context: A group of Finnish women consuming >71 g of apple/d experienced a 43% reduction in coronary mortality compared to women who did not eat apples. In men, the risk reduction was 19% in the group consuming >54 g compared to no apple intake . These findings were consistent with prior data showing reduced coronary mortality in elderly Dutch men (65-84 y) who consumed apples (average 69 g/d) compared to men who had little or no apple intake .
Medicine_7_r.text: ['Finding: However, the study found that you can significantly lower your risk for cardiovascular disease by eating fresh fruit, including apples.']
Medicine_7_r.displayed_text: Finding: However, the study found that you can significantly lower your risk for cardiovascular disease by eating fresh fruit, including apples.

Medicine_tweet_11_r.News Finding: Male and female brains are more similar than previously thought. Interesting paper in PNAS
Medicine_tweet_11_r.Paper Finding: Here we show that, although there are sex/gender differences in brain and behavior, humans and human brains are comprised of unique "mosaics" of features, some more common in females compared with males, some more common in males compared with females, and some common in both females and males.
Medicine_tweet_11_r.News Context: Male and female brains are more similar than previously thought. Interesting paper in PNAS
Medicine_tweet_11_r.Paper Context: Such an alignment may be predicted by the classic view of sexual differentiation of the brain, according to which masculinization and defeminization of the brain are under the sole influence of testosterone (9). Here we show that, although there are sex/gender differences in brain and behavior, humans and human brains are comprised of unique "mosaics" of features, some more common in females compared with males, some more common in males compared with females, and some common in both females and males. Our results demonstrate that regardless of the cause of observed sex/gender differences in brain and behavior (nature or nurture), human brains cannot be categorized into two distinct classes: male brain/female brain.
Medicine_tweet_11_r.text: ['Finding: Male and female brains are more similar than previously thought. Interesting paper in PNAS ']
Medicine_tweet_11_r.displayed_text: Finding: Male and female brains are more similar than previously thought. Interesting paper in PNAS
